author: ansgar.eth
content:
The next call is today!

Topic will be short-term EL scaling features.
Preliminary agenda: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/1532
Time slot is eth-o-clock (14:00 UTC, 90min). Will post zoom link in <#745077610685661265> before the call.

author: sky.cactus
content: <@415548822983278593> In the call you mentioned that you felt that CR and Scaling was a false dichotomy.  I think you were correct in recognizing that censorship resistance of inclusion is different from CR of state access, and there is a third axis that we didn't talk about which is privacy of state access and inclusion.  However, I'm not nearly as convinced as you that the problem of state access and privacy of state access and inclusion are actually solvable while scaling in the ways people want (more storage).  Almost none of the scaling proposals address them, and the few proposals I have heard of I don't think are technically possible using today's technology (like HME).

author: sky.cactus
content: At the least, I feel like the Ethereum research team should spend some time figuring out how we can actually solve those problems.  At best, we should prioritize solving those problems *before* we scale Ethereum, so we aren't making the trade of CR for Scale.

author: sky.cactus
content: I generally agree with you that there is good research on censorship resistance of inclusion, and I'm optimistic that <@755590043632140352> will champion that hard enough that it actually happens.  (sorry for the ping Potuz, I accidentally typed @silence instead of @silent).

author: potuz
content: Lol don't get your hopes up, I've only championed ONE thing for the last 2 years and an entirely different approach orders of magnitude more complicated and less efficient was deviced to simply not include it.
